	<item>
		<title>Field of Dreams</title>
		<link>http://redarrowmedia.com/2012/03/26/field-dreams/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 26 Mar 2012 18:25:58 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>nessajoy</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://slingstonemedia.com/?p=445</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p style="text-align:center;"><strong>Field of Dreams</strong><a href="http://slingstonemedia.com/wp-content/uploads/2011/09/Sara-Rust.jpg"><img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-498" title="Sara Rust" src="http://slingstonemedia.com/wp-content/uploads/2011/09/Sara-Rust-300x244.jpg" alt="" width="300" height="244" /></a></p>
<p style="text-align:center;"><em>by Sara Rust</em></p>
There was no need to awaken the day or the night in this part of the universe, for time was inconsequential. Â Thus, Invested knew that there must be a reason for the dimming light.

Invested stood in a nondescript field.Â  All around him, the grass swayed across small hills.Â  As the light continued to fade, the edges of the grass blades began to glow an ethereal gold. Unsure whether he had arrived at his destination, he thought it best to double-check his invitation.

Taking it out from his pocket, he saw gold lines taking shape, as if the unseen author was still at work. They glowed like the grass beneath his feet.Â  As he watched the lines emerge, he noticed their surprising addition to the invitation â a map.Â  Studying it, he could make out a path, one depicted by a gold line that faded into variegated colors and twisted through rolling fields. He wondered what the colors might mean, and how to follow the path.

Invested turned his attention back to the field and noticed that a patch of grass before him was now glowing a fanciful red.Â  As soon as he stepped into the glowing grass, a new patch began to glow the same color of the next patch on the map.Â  One step after another, Invested navigated the luminous field over hills and dales and finally found himself at a flat clearing.Â  He couldn't help but laugh at the sight before him.

âIs it shocking?â Papa joked from behind him.

âI should have guessed,â Invested admitted.

Papa nodded.Â  âPerhaps.Â  You do have a knack for solving conundrums.â Smiling, he approached Invested with open arms and embraced him.

âIt's a nice field,â Invested offered as he looked again at the bases, foul lines, and pitcher's mound before him.Â  The grass was intensely green, and the boundary lines were pristinely white.Â  It was the most striking baseball field Invested had ever seen.

âI was hoping you'd like it,â Papa replied, âHow about we try her out?â Without waiting for a response, Papa tossed Invested a perfectly worn baseball glove, and the two headed out to the field.

âYou pitch, Invested.â

Invested began to walk towards the pitcher's mound, then turned to Papa, âWhat am I pitching?â

Smiling, Papa held up his palm, asking for a moment.Â  He walked behind the backstop and picked up a canvas bag.Â  Jogging over to Invested, He handed him the bag, then resumed His position beside home plate.Â  Invested continued on to the pitcher's mound where he dropped the bag and looked over the parameters of the field.Â  Bending down and opening the bag, Invested froze.Â  He'd never seen anything like them.Â  Inside were strange transparent balls, and inside each of them danced little flames of light.Â  They looked especially impressive under the dimming sky. He reached down to pick one up, finding the consistency of the ball to be flexible yet delicate.Â  He wondered if he might pop it by handling it too hard.Â  He looked up at Papa, puzzled.

âI'm ready!â Papa said, swinging the bat with great anticipation.

Invested looked back down at the balls, shaking his head, âUm, Papaâ he paused contemplating what to do, âI think...I think I might break them...whatever they are.â

âThey're sturdier than they feel, Invested. Come on!Â  I'm ready!âÂ  Papa placed his feet intentionally, bending his knees, and finding his balance.

Invested was enchanted by these strange spheres and took little notice of Papa, primed to swing.Â  Papa watched him, and smiled.Â  He finally dropped his bat and stood up straight.

âThey're dreams!â Papa cried out.

âDreams?â Invested rolled one around in his hands. âFascinating.â He studied it with keen interest, observing its colors and texture.

Papa knew Invested would be taken with them, He loved Invested's inquisitive nature.

âInvested?â Papa called again.

Invested finally looked back up at Papa.

âThose are <em>your</em> dreams, Invested,â Papa said calmly and grinned, âwhy don't you pitch one to me?â

âOh,â Invested gathered himself again, âright, Papa, right.â It was time to get back in the game.

Papa took His stance, wiggled His hips, and pulled back the bat.

As Invested drew back his arm, he felt the dream firm up, as if preparing for the journey. Just before the ball left his hand, it felt as solid and sure as a baseball.Â  Flying towards home plate, the dream began to grow brighter, and the moment Papa hit it, a great fusion of light and sound burst forth from inside the dream, cascading all around like a dazzling firework.Â  The dream soared high above Invested's head, beyond second base, to the outskirts of the field.Â  And just when he thought it might land, that little dream swooped straight up into the sky again and began to gallivant in all directions over the field, flying up and down and circling around.Â  It was quite content to remain in flight.

âThey like to fly,â Papa explained.

Invested watched the dream hurling to and fro around the field, in all its fantastic light and color.Â  It was mezmerising.

âPitch me another, Invested!â Papa finally shouted.

With the first dream flying happily overhead, Invested pitched another.Â  Within a few minutes there were nearly twenty dreams flying above, creating a marvelous light show.Â  Invested reached down into the bag and pulled out a sizeable dream, one his hands could barely grip.Â  He wondered how he was going to throw this one to Papa.

âIt's okay,â Papa affirmed, âI'm fond of the big ones, just pitch it!â

Trying not to think too much about the physics of the problem, Invested drew back his arm, balancing the large dream.Â  With a deep breath, he pitched it right over home plate.

The bat hit the dream launching it straight up to join the flock of other dreams now swarming above.Â  Stunning balls of colorful light filled the sky like an animated starry night. At times the dreams would fly in formation then burst forth into solo acrobatic routines.

Invested stood back from the pitcher's mound gazing up at the sky.Â  Papa dropped the bat and walked over towards Invested.Â âBeautiful, isn't it?Â  Your dreams are beautiful.â He mused.

âThey look better in the sky.â Invested remarked.

âIt's a team effort.â Papa placed his hand on Invested's shoulder.

âThere are so many,â Invested shook his head in disbelief at the sight before him.

Papa smirked and patted Invested on the back, âand this is only a small sampling of your dreams, Invested.â

Papa watched Invested try to follow the dreams as they danced about the sky.Â  Moments later, Invested felt something touch his hands. Papa was handing him a large net, like one used to catch butterflies, but a great deal bigger. Invested broke his gaze from the sky to grab the net. He thought he knew what the net must be for, but he gave Papa a questioning look.

Papa raised an eyebrow.Â  His eyes twinkled with adventure. âNow, it's time to catch one.âÂ  Invested looked back up into the sky and over at Papa again.

âPapa, how do you expect me to catch one of those?

âThat's what the net is for.â Papa replied nonchalantly.

Invested looked at the net and back at Papa, and shook his head, âHave you been watching those little guys dashing around up there?Â  Sometimes they're so fast, I can't even see them!â

Papa simply nodded his head in encouragement, âIt's best to wait for them to fly close to the ground.â

Invested meandered out towards the outfield, net in hand.

âInvested, keep your eye on the ball.â Papa winked.

Invested tried to focus on the dreams above as they jetted by.Â  Occasionally they would descend at a lightening speed and swoop past Invested.Â  He could feel the wind swirl around him.

Papa's voice rose,Â âChoose one, Invested, and stare it down!Â  Don't take your eyes off of it!â

Invested looked overhead to see the great speedway of dreams and purposed to find just one he could keep his eye on.Â  In a few moments he found one, a smallish dream with blue flames burning inside. With great concentration, he followed it with his eyes.Â  The more he watched it, the more it seemed to slow down, until finally the little dream stopped, and began heading straight towards him.

âHold your net out, Invested!â Papa cried.

Invested kept his eyes peeled on the dream as it approached him, and lifted the net overhead.Â  Soon the dream gently found its way right into the net, where it settled as if it wanted a nap.Â  Invested looked back at Papa with a surprised smile.

Papa nodded with pride.Â âGreat job, Invested.Â  Executed like a pro.â

Invested walked back to Papa, now with a dream tucked safely in his net.Â  He held out his catch to Papa, unsure what to do next.

Papa looked the dream over with wonder. âIt's a good one, Invested.â

Invested smiled.

Looking Invested straight in the eye, He instructed, âNow, you eat it.â

âI what?â Invested wasn't sure if he'd heard Papa correctly.

âYou eat it, and honestly the quicker the better, before it sneaks off again.â

Invested wrinkled his brow as he slowly placed his hand inside the net to capture the dream.Â  Once he had it balanced in his hand, he dropped the net and held the dream with both hands. It felt different.Â  It wasn't like the jelly-ball it had been in the bag or the baseball it had been in his pitching hand.Â  It felt soft, like a peach, and tingled with life. Invested looked up at Papa.

Papa shrugged his shoulders, âI have that effect.â

Invested drew the dream towards his nose and sniffed.Â  It smelled sweet and expectant.Â  He sighed and at last took a bite.

He could feel the life that tingled within the dream flow down his throat and finally reside in his belly.Â  It was a strange sensation, to eat a dream, to feel it begin to stir life within him.Â  It was as if the dream itself was hosting a rally within to win the allegiance of his spirit, mind, soul, and body.Â  Things were happening inside him, and all he could explain was that he felt more alive than before he took the bite.

Papa was enthralled. He loved moments like these, seeing the ones He loved enjoying the wonders of the Kingdom.

âAm I to eat it all, Papa?â Invested looked at Papa wondering if the lesson had come to an end.

Papa smiled and looked at the dream Invested held and then up into the sky full of dancing dreams,Â  âEat as much as you like.Â  Eat much or eat little.Â  All I ask is that you enjoy the feast.â

Invested took account of his settings.Â  How marvelous and odd to be eating a dream before Papa under a sky illuminated by dreams.

âYou wonder what is the meaning of all of this, don't you?â Papa asked.

Invested nodded, dream still in hand, now beginning to drip an iridescent juice down his fingers.

âBut the truth is,â Papa said with a grin, âyou are far too observant and clever for me to simply explain this mystery.Â  Tell me what you have seen.â

And although it would have been easy for Papa to unravel the tale, Invested admitted he desired a go at it.Â  His eyes searched the landscape while his mind recalled the experience.Â  Soon something began to stand out to Invested as significant.

âThe dreams,â Invested began, âall came from you.Â  You handed me the bag full of dreams.â

Papa grinned. âThe capacity to dream, the tendency to dream, the propensity to dream for certain things, true.Â  I gave that to you.Â  But the bag was filled with your own dreams, things birthed in your own heart, in your own mind.Â  I just have pleasure in hanging on to them all.â

Invested nodded with understanding.Â  âI had a bag full of dreams, they all had potential, all teemed with light.Â  But something changed when I pitched them to you.â

âSomething remarkable happens when you pick up a dream, turn your eyes towards Me, and then offer Me the dream.Â  Did you notice how the dream changed, Invested?â

âIt firmed up.Â  It began to take shape.â Invested answered.

âEven the loftiest dreams, sense possibility when directed at Me. For with Me all things are possible.Â  Dreams know this.Â  When you begin to pitch, they begin to prepare themselves to transfer from the realm of imagination to possibility.â

Invested peered overhead again to watch the dreams flying above.Â  He nodded his head towards the sky, âThose then, those are dreams that have become possible, is that right?â

âMore than possible. Alive.Â  Fused with purpose, power, and longevity. Released to dazzle all who set their eyes on them.Â  A dream touched by my hand becomes a vessel to expand my kingdom.Â  They take flight because they are so full of life.Â  And there they wait,â Papa directed his vision towards the sky, âin this field of dreams, for one who might see them, one who might catch them, one who might eat them and let them come to fruition. That, Invested, is their greatest desire.â

Papa closed his eyes, âI wish you could see it, Invested.Â  I wish you could see the sight of the field full of all of the dreams of man.Â  No dream is ever lost, you see.Â  When they come to me, they reside together up there, and so they have since man first dreamed.Â  How remarkable the sight when one comes and catches an ancient dream, which like fine wine has been soaring above throughout the ages with ever increasing expectancy. For to dream is to invest, not only that you might carry a dream, but that others might carry one of yours in a day or a year a generation or so.Â  I've even seen dreams merge and multiply up there. It's simply astonishing.â

Invested stood still as Papa grew silent.Â  He looked up into the sky as his ears began to tune in only to the majestic sound of the flying dreams. If he closed his eyes he might convince himself he was beginning to fly, and so Invested did, as he lost himself in the sound.Â  Papa watched him joyously.Â  He quietly approached Invested and gently placed his hand on Investedâs shoulder.Â  The wind around them increased as Papa, for a moment, unveiled the sound of the dreams of all men from all time to the ears of this beloved son.Â  In that spectacular moment Invested could hear the sound of a kingdom â of voices, and songs, and movement and abundant life dictated solely by the wind above.Â  About the time that Invested thought the sound might crush him, Papa removed his hand and took a step back.

âYou have invested in my kingdom,â Papa spoke at last. âYour dreams are good, and not one has been lost.Â  You have a good arm and pitch well.Â  I want to invite you again, Invested, to throw me a new dream or find a dream you might like to taste, to set your eyes on it, and catch it.Â  Whatever delights you.Â  There is no failure here.Â  For the dreams of man cannot shift my goodness or my love. I am faithful to complete the good work I started in you and in this world.Â  So when I invite you to dream, I invite you to play.Â  Do you see?Â  It is not a test.Â  It's an invitation, simply to do something with me.â

Invested stood drinking in this fresh freedom.

Papa took a deep breath.Â  He picked up Invested's glove that was resting on the ground beside them.Â  âPlay with me?â He asked as He offered Invested the glove again.

Invested was standing with his hands on his hips gazing up again into the bountiful sky of dreams.Â  He looked down at the glove, and up at Papa.

âI'd like that,â he said simply reaching for the glove.Â  By the time Invested reached the pitcher's mound again, the canvas bag that had previously been emptied, was full of dreams again.

Throughout the kingdom the crack of the bat and the whirl of dreams could be heard as Invested pitched and Papa launched dream upon dream high above the field into the realms of possibility and hope and life.]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Renee Evans</title>
		<link>http://redarrowmedia.com/2012/03/25/renee-renaissance-evans/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 25 Mar 2012 23:26:29 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>homeandinbetween</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://redarrowmedia.wordpress.com/?p=482</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p><a href="http://redarrowmedia.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/renee-bio-1.jpg"><img class="aligncenter" title="Renee in Chico, California" src="http://redarrowmedia.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/renee-bio-1.jpg" alt="" width="614" height="324" /></a></p>
<p>RenÃ©e Evans works as a freelance format designer, based in Redding, California. Before moving to California three and a half years ago, RenÃ©e was the acquisitions/production manager of a book publishing company located in her hometown of Sydney, Australia. Renee works with authors who desire to create a product that is infused with passion, relevance, creativity, and excellence. Having had the responsibility of managing an author through every stage of publishing, from manuscript reviews to design to marketing, she has experience in the full publishing process.</p>
<p><a href="http://redarrowmedia.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/renee-bio-2.jpg"><img class="alignright" title="Renee with husband Joaquin" src="http://redarrowmedia.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/renee-bio-2.jpg?w=300" alt="" width="300" height="227" /></a>RenÃ©e married Joaquin Evans in 2011, and they now travel the world together to places where people desire to see what Jesus is doing in the twenty-first century. She loves the freedom that freelance work gives, enabling her to live both her passions for travel and for the written word. Her workspace is often a tray table, 30,000 feet off the ground.</p>
<p>She is passionate about revival, family, fun, food, great shoes, art, adventure, and so much more. One of her favorite quotes to say is that she gets paid to do what she would do for free.</p>
<p>RenÃ©e is a co-founder of Red Arrow Media, and she manages social media and book design.</p>
<p><a href="mailto:renee@redarrowmedia.com">Email</a> RenÃ©e.</p>
<p>Follow her blog:Â <a href="http://homeandinbetween.com/" target="_blank">http://homeandinbetween.com/</a></p>

	<item>
		<title>Jessica Glasner</title>
		<link>http://redarrowmedia.com/2012/03/25/jessica-glasner/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 25 Mar 2012 23:46:56 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>jessicaglasner</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://redarrowmedia.wordpress.com/?p=487</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://redarrowmedia.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/jessica-bio-1.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-488" title="Jessica and her beloved books" src="http://redarrowmedia.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/jessica-bio-1.jpg" alt="" width="614" height="321" /></a>

Jessica Glasner is a Northern California-based writer, editor, and story consultant. She offers a wide range of editorial and media services, including ghostwriting and content development.Â  Her clients includeÂ authors Wayne Jacobsen (the publisher ofÂ <em>The Shack</em>), Robert Krebs, professional football coach George Naum, and Robbie Frank.

Jessica graduated from Westmont CollegeÂ <em>Summa Cum</em>Â <em>Laude.Â  </em>In the past she taught drama, modern dance, and ballet, as well as English to high school students outside Guangzhou, China.Â  Furthermore, she produced several short films and a live musical production for the West Valley Co-Op.Â  Her heart is to see the world transformed by the truth, beauty, and glory of God one person at a time.

<a href="http://redarrowmedia.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/jessica-bio-2.jpg"><img class="alignleft size-medium wp-image-489" title="Jess and her dog" src="http://redarrowmedia.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/jessica-bio-2.jpg?w=290" alt="" width="290" height="300" /></a>Jessica loves photography, eclectic music, exploring foreign countries, Â the history of cinema,Â backpacking, outrigger canoeing, kayaking, painting, BSSM, a good story, and laughing so hard her stomach hurts.Â  She speaks Modern Hebrew and enough Mandarin to order a glass a tea.

If she is not writing or reading a book, you will probably find her hanging out with her friends and family, or her wonderdog Buddy Valentine, a seventy-five-pound golden doodle.

Jessica is a co-founder of Red Arrow Media and works as a creative writer, editor, and researcher.

<a href="mailto:jessica@redarrowmedia.com">Email</a> Jessica.

<strong>What are people saying about Jessica?</strong>

<em>âQuick, skilled, and talented.Â  I donât know what I could say more about Jessicaâs work for me as a writer.Â  She has done amazing work in compiling, editing, and formatting my past writings to prepare them for re-publishing.Â  She is able to organize, condense, and write bridge material all with an eye to match my voice and tone so the final work is seamless.Â  I can think of no one to recommend more highly than Jessica to help with your writing project"</em> <strong>(<a title="Windblown Media" href="http://windblownmedia.com/" target="_blank">Wayne Jacobsen</a>, original publisher of <em>The Shack</em> by William P. Young)</strong>.

<em>âI have used the excellent editorial services of Jessica Glasner while writing my novels. Â Her insight into plot and character development is remarkable.Â Jessica also provided some unique perspective that allowed me to make my novels more realistic and enjoyable. Â She is easy to work with, but also very professional. Â I will continue to use Ms. Glasnerâs editorial services in the future and would recommend her to anyone looking for a thoughtful and thorough editor"</em> <strong>(<a title="R.H. Krebs" href="http://www.crimsonthebook.com/" target="_blank">R.H. Krebs</a>, author of <em>Crimson</em>)</strong>.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Vanessa J. Chandler</title>
		<link>http://redarrowmedia.com/2012/03/23/vanessa-j-chandler/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 23 Mar 2012 00:14:01 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>nessajoy</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://redarrowmedia.wordpress.com/?p=498</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://redarrowmedia.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/mg_5327.jpg"><img class="alignleft size-medium wp-image-500" title="Vanessa Joy Chandler" src="http://redarrowmedia.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/mg_5327.jpg?w=200" alt="" width="200" height="300" /></a>Vanessa Joy Chandler is a published author, poet, and artist. She has been a freelance writer and editor since 2004. She spent her childhood in Malawi and Kenya, Africa, as a daughter of missionary parents. Much of her exposure to other nations and education has developed in her a desire to travel, write, and minister to people. She has visited numerous countries, lived on four continents, and completed a Bachelor of Arts in Literature, a certification as a teacher, and counseling and ministerial training through Bethel's School of Supernatural Ministry.

Vanessa has received recognition for her pursuits in leadership, music, teaching, and writing; has been a guest speakerÂ at Writing Unto the Glory; and is a co-founder, general manager, creative writer, and senior editor for Red Arrow Media. She has completed writing/editing projects for ABC-CLIO educational publishers, Book of Hope, <a title="iMatter AIDS Curriculum" href="http://redarrowmedia.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/scan-6.jpeg" target="_blank">Hope Education</a>, HigherLife Development Services, Destiny Image Publishers, Regal/Gospel Light Publishing, and numerous private clients, and she has written articles for <em>Charisma</em> and <em><a title="&quot;Laws of Successful Outreach&quot; in CALLED" href="http://redarrowmedia.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/laws-of-successful-outreach.pdf" target="_blank">CALLED</a></em> magazines. She has also been an active member in non-profit associations, such as Taste of Hope, a fundraiser for orphans in Ethiopia, based in Santa Barbara, California.<a href="http://redarrowmedia.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/img_0791.jpg"><img class="alignright size-thumbnail wp-image-559" title="White charcoal drawing of &quot;Fetus&quot; cover of TIME magazine" src="http://redarrowmedia.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/img_0791.jpg?w=142" alt="" width="142" height="150" /></a>

Vanessa Chandler has also been a teacher since 1999. Her teaching experience includes locations such as CostaÂ Rica, Spain, and Croatia, where she has taught American and international students in subjects such as ESL, English Literature, Religion, Latin, and History.

<a href="http://redarrowmedia.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/spain-095.jpg"><img class="alignleft size-medium wp-image-572" title="Across from Alhambra Palace, Granada, Spain" src="http://redarrowmedia.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/spain-095.jpg?w=300" alt="" width="300" height="225" /></a>If Vanessa's not sipping coffee at a privately owned, authentic coffee shop somewhere in the world, she might be foundÂ hiking the Italian Alps. She might be found driving a four-wheel drive SUV through the backwoods of a forest, visiting a random art museum, sipping wine in Napa Valley, California, swimming in the warm waves of Acapulco, Mexico...or spending quality time with her much-loved family and friends at home in northern California.

<a href="mailto:vanessa@redarrowmedia.com">Email</a> Vanessa.

Follow Vanessa's blogs: <a href="http://veritasthebook.org" target="_blank">www.veritasthebook.org</a>Â andÂ <a href="http://adventuresofthesinglelife.com" target="_blank">www.adventuresofthesinglelife.com</a>Â <a href="http://redarrowmedia.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/img_0787.jpg"><img class="alignright size-thumbnail wp-image-558" title="Comic sketch" src="http://redarrowmedia.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/img_0787.jpg?w=150" alt="" width="150" height="113" /></a>

<strong>What are People Saying about Vanessa?</strong>

<em><em>"Vanessa Chandler worked in the military history division of ABC-CLIO in 2008. She quickly proved herself to be a very bright, talented, dedicated, and personable worker. She proofread hundreds of encyclopedic entries and demonstrated a sharp eye for detail. She also wrote more than 100 document introductions for primary sources for ourÂ </em><em>United States</em><em>Â at War database. Her ability to grasp the essence of these historical documents and put them into their proper context was impressive, as was the quality of her writing skills. I highly recommend her to any company looking for a highly motivated person with strong editing and writing skills"</em>Â </em><strong>(Pat Carlin, Manager, Editorial Development for Military History, <a title="ABC-CLIO Publishers" href="http://www.abc-clio.com/" target="_blank">ABC-CLIO</a>).</strong>

<em>"I wrote my first book in 2004 and sent the manuscript to a publisher. The publisher wrote back saying in essence that my content was good but that I really wasn't a writer. I got so discouraged that I quit writing for a year. Then one afternoon I met Vanessa Chandler at a retreat. I told her about my experience with the publisher and she asked me if she could read the manuscript. I handed her my computer and she read what I had written for about an hour. When she was done reading the first few chapters of my book she said, âyour writing is excellent and your content is really revelatory. I don't know what that publisher was talking about but you are a really gifted writer.â Vanessa and another editor helped me finish my manuscript and six months later that book, which is entitled,Â <a title="Supernatural Ways of Royalty" href="http://redarrowmedia.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/511m90dubul-_bo2204203200_pisitb-sticker-arrow-clicktopright35-76_aa300_sh20_ou01_.jpg" target="_blank">The Supernatural Ways Of Royalty</a>, went on to become a bestseller! Since that time I've written seven other books in which, three more of them have become bestsellers. I credit Vanessa Chandler with discovering my talent and helping to teach me to how to become a professional author. I highly recommend Vanessa to any author" </em><strong>(<a title="Kris &amp; Kathy Vallotton Ministries" href="http://kvministries.com/" target="_blank">Kris Vallotton</a>,Â Senior Associate Leader of Bethel Church, and Co-founder &amp; Overseer of Bethel School of Supernatural Ministry in Redding, California).Â </strong>
<div><em>"Vanessa was an extremely good listener. Â She captured the essence of the story or point I was making and was able to enrich it or enhance it through her writing ability and her overall knowledge of the literary world"</em> <strong>(<a title="Mike Frank Consulting" href="http://mikefrankconsulting.com/" target="_blank">Mike Frank</a>, founder of Level 3 Communications, a multi-billion dollar company, and author of <em><a title="Prosperity with Purpose" href="http://www.amazon.com/Prosperity-With-Purpose-Executives-Significance/dp/0983814007/ref=sr_1_2?ie=UTF8&amp;qid=1333216291&amp;sr=8-2" target="_blank">Prosperity with Purpose</a></em>).</strong></div>
<div></div>
<div><em>"Vanessa came to us with a proposal to write Mike's book that was beyond anything we had hoped for. We were so grateful for the time and hard work she put into every story and the beautiful way she took a simple story and made it into something that was compelling, delightful and full of intense emotion and beauty for the often difficult stories of our lives. Â Her hard work and dedication was so appreciated and she was a delight to work with"</em><strong> <strong>(Robbie Frank, wife of Mike Frank &amp; leader in the Redding community).</strong></strong></div>
<p style="text-align:left;"><strong><a href="http://redarrowmedia.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/mg_5399.jpg">
</a><a href="http://redarrowmedia.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/mg_5422.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-medium wp-image-560" title="Vanessa's Journal" src="http://redarrowmedia.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/mg_5422.jpg?w=300" alt="" width="300" height="200" /></a></strong></p>
<p style="text-align:left;"><strong>When will Vanessa's first novel be released?</strong></p>
Vanessa's first historical fiction novel in the <a title="Veritas the book" href="http://veritasthebook.org/" target="_blank">Veritas Saga</a>, <em>Earth</em>, is due to be released in 2012.Â <em>Veritas</em>Â (meaning âtruthâ in Latin) is a book project Vanessa began in 2001 while living in Barcelona, Spain. She has completed years of research, consulted historical experts, and traveled to many sites described in the book.

The plot is as follows: In 1492, a young Christian woman, a prophet of light, a Jew, and a Muslim mercenary all escape perilous situations within the throes of the Inquisition to search for the One, a god far from the one that has been passed on by religious traditions. The charactersâ journeys coincide and take them through treacherous adventures as they are thrust beyond the veil of the natural world into the supernatural. Demons accompany the evil-hearted and angels aide those desiring truth, climaxing at a battle for the freedom of humankind, which sets the stage for the long-awaited spiritual reformation in the following century.

<em>View the historicalÂ timeline that corresponds to the story:</em>

<a href="http://redarrowmedia.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/veritastimeline5.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-499" title="Veritas Historical Timeline" src="http://redarrowmedia.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/veritastimeline5.jpg" alt="" width="614" height="373" /></a>

<em><a href="http://slingstonemedia.com/wp-content/uploads/2011/07/veritastimeline5-1.jpg">â¨</a></em>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Amy Calkins</title>
		<link>http://redarrowmedia.com/2012/03/25/amy-calkins/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 25 Mar 2012 22:08:37 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>editamy</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://redarrowmedia.wordpress.com/?p=533</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div>

<a href="http://redarrowmedia.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/amyc-photo3.jpg"><img class="alignleft size-full wp-image-534" title="Amy Calkins" src="http://redarrowmedia.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/amyc-photo3.jpg" alt="" width="614" height="409" /></a>

Amy Calkins is a professional writer and editor and a published poet. Her poems have been published in <em><a title="Relief Journal" href="http://www.reliefjournal.com/" target="_blank">Relief Journal</a> </em>and in the anthologies, <em><a title="Becoming Fire" href="http://www.ants.edu/publications/online/becoming-fire/" target="_blank">Becoming Fire</a> </em>(ANTS 2006) and <a href="http://martyrbook.com/"><em>Tongue Screws and Testimonies </em></a>(Herald Press 2010). They are also forthcoming in <em><a title="Radix Magazine" href="http://www.radixmagazine.com/" target="_blank">Radix Magazine</a>. </em>After earning her B.A. in English from Grove City College, in Pennsylvania, she spent a year working in communications for a non-profit Christian mission organization before launching into her freelance career.

For the last five years, she has worked with individuals and Christian ministries, as well as with Christian publishing houses, to bring increased excellence to their written publications. Amy is an effective writer who can express complex ideas with clarity and simplicity. She recognizes redundancy, illogical arguments, and disorganization, and she often has great ideas for how to fix them.

<img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-535" title="Amy Calkins, Poet" src="http://redarrowmedia.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/amyc-photo2.jpg?w=200" alt="" width="200" height="300" />As a published poet, Amy is one who loves the sounds of language and has an ear for sentence structure that is not simply correct, but also appealing. She has a proven track record of consistently catching punctuation, grammar, and formatting errors, and she places a high value on excellence. Amy has a solid knowledge of the Bible and has worked with clients from a variety of Christian backgrounds, including evangelical, charismatic, Mennonite, Anglican, and Presbyterian.

Amyâs areas of expertise and experience include Christian motivational and instructional non-fiction as well as business and real estate. Through her work for Destiny Image Publishers, she has edited books for many modern Christian leaders. She also has performed ghostwriting for several best-selling authors.

Amy, her husband, Mark, and their three children, Abigail (5), Evan (3), and Susanna (1), recently moved from Rochester, New York, to Redding, California, where they are enjoying the persistent sunshine and the community at Bethel Church.

Amy is a ghostwriter, creative writer and an editor for Red Arrow Media.

<a href="mailto:amy@redarrowmedia.com">Email</a> Amy.

Follow Amy atÂ <a title="Aurora Writing and Editing Services" href="http://aurora-pub.com/home.htm" target="_blank">http://aurora-pub.com/home.htm</a>

</div>
<p align="center"><strong><a href="http://redarrowmedia.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/amyc-photo1.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-medium wp-image-542" title="Amy against tree" src="http://redarrowmedia.files.wordpress.com/2012/03/amyc-photo1.jpg?w=300" alt="" width="300" height="200" /></a></strong></p>
<p align="center"><strong>Endorsements</strong></p>
<em>"Amy has an amazing ability to get to the heart of the project. She is wonderfully diligent and focused. I highly recommend her in any of your literary ventures"</em> <strong>(Danny Silk,Â <a title="Loving on Purpose" href="http://lovingonpurpose.com/" target="_blank">Founder of Loving On Purpose Ministries</a>,Â Bethel Church Senior Leadership Team &amp;Â Author ofÂ <em>Loving Our Kids on PurposeÂ </em>andÂ <em>Culture of Honor).</em></strong>
<div align="center">

<hr align="center" size="2" width="100%" />

</div>
<em>"Amy Calkins is not only a dear friend, but also a tremendous writer and editor. I have had the pleasure of working with her on three of my books, and she is a gift of God. I would strongly urge anyone to work with her; she will help you take your writing to a whole new level"</em> <strong>(Jonathan Welton,Â Director of <a href="http://www.jonwelton.com/">Welton Academy</a> &amp;Â Author ofÂ <em>School of the Seers, Normal Christianity, Eyes of Honor,Â </em>and<em>Â Raptureless).</em></strong>
<div align="center">

<hr align="center" size="2" width="100%" />

</div>
<em>"I want to recommend to you Amy Calkins for your next writing or editing project! Amy has done several projects for me, and I am extremely happy with her good work"</em> <strong>(Bobby Conner,Â <a title="Eagle's View Ministries" href="http://www.bobbyconner.org/" target="_blank">Founder of Eagles View Ministries</a> &amp;Â Author ofÂ <em>Godâs Supernatural Power, The Justice of God,</em>Â and the annual publication,Â <em>The Shepherdâs Rod).</em></strong>
<div align="center">

<hr align="center" size="2" width="100%" />

</div>
<em>"Our company has contracted with Amy Calkins regularly over the last five years. I have always been pleased with her timeliness, excellence, and attention to detail. I commend her to you for your writing and editing needs"</em><strong> (Dean Drawbaugh,Â General Manager/Controller atÂ Destiny Image Publishers).</strong>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Allison Armerding</title>
		<link>http://redarrowmedia.com/2012/04/02/allison-armerding/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 02 Apr 2012 21:44:05 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>nessajoy</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://redarrowmedia.wordpress.com/?p=627</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<div>

<span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:regular;"><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:regular;"><a href="http://redarrowmedia.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/allison.jpg"><img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-632" title="Allison Armerding" src="http://redarrowmedia.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/allison.jpg?w=239" alt="" width="239" height="300" /></a><span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:regular;">My relationship with English literature began withÂ <em>Goodnight MoonÂ </em>andÂ <em>The Runaway Bunny,Â </em>grew withÂ <em>The BabysitterâsÂ </em></span><em>ClubÂ </em>series, Narnia, and MontgomeryâsÂ <em>AnneÂ </em>novels, and became serious in high school with Austen, the BrontÃ«s, Shakespeare, the Romantic poets, and David James Duncan. My mother, an English teacher and insatiable reader, deserves credit for encouraging this passion, and it was only natural for me to follow in her footsteps and earn a degree in the subject. I spent my junior year of college reading 19<sup>th</sup>Â and 20<sup>th</sup>Â century British literature and literary theory at Oxford University, which, as I often tell people, is where I learned to write. According to the wisdom of classical education, thereâs nothing like writing a ten-page critical essay every week and reading it to your tutor to teach you to organize and express your thoughts, and this proved to be the case for me.Â </span></span>

<span style="font-family:Arial;font-size:regular;">In 2005, about the time I also decided to go back to school for music, I took on my first freelance editing project. While pursuing bachelor's and master's degrees in classical voice performance, I managed a steady stream of book projects and learned plenty of lessons on what and what not to do as an editor and ghostwriter. The majority of these projects were spiritual teaching books authored by leaders at Bethel Church in Redding, CA. Through this focused work in one genre, I developed, among many other things, a quick eye for disorganization, redundancy, andÂ </span>missing,Â half-baked or unclear points in an author's message, and the skills and strategies to fix them. I amÂ passionate about excellence, economy, and truth-telling, and rely on a steady diet of C.S. Lewis, G.K. Chesterton, J.R.R. Tolkien and other masters of language and common sense to keep my mind and words in shape.

Allison is an developmental editor, editor and ghostwriter for Red Arrow Media.

<a href="mailto:allison@redarrowmedia.com">Email</a> Allison.

</div>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Benjamin Goodpasture</title>
		<link>http://redarrowmedia.com/2012/04/06/benjamin-goodpasture/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 06 Apr 2012 23:19:21 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>benjamingoodpasture</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://redarrowmedia.wordpress.com/?p=669</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://redarrowmedia.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/222228_843211465598_29707721_41652889_6867253_n.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-678 aligncenter" title="surfing" src="http://redarrowmedia.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/222228_843211465598_29707721_41652889_6867253_n.jpg" alt="" width="614" height="268" /></a>
<p style="text-align:center;"></p>
<p style="text-align:center;">Benjamin Abraham Goodpasture</p>
<p style="text-align:center;">Marketing Director</p>
<p style="text-align:center;">Red Arrow Media</p>
<p style="text-align:center;"></p>
<p style="text-align:left;"><a href="http://redarrowmedia.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/269597_906818406778_29707721_42339950_779190_n3.jpg"><img class="alignleft  wp-image-685" title="surfing" src="http://redarrowmedia.files.wordpress.com/2012/04/269597_906818406778_29707721_42339950_779190_n3.jpg?w=200" alt="" width="160" height="240" /></a></p>
<p style="text-align:left;">Benjamin Abraham Goodpasture is an investor of people and their hearts. He loves life and lives with courage and passion. He is always speaking life through encouragement and positive words; all friends feel there is something unique in them. Jesus said, "Love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your strength and with all your mind; and love your neighbor as yourself. Do this and you will live".</p>
<p style="text-align:left;"></p>
<p style="text-align:left;"></p>
<p style="text-align:left;"></p>
<p style="text-align:left;"></p>
<p style="text-align:center;"></p>
<p style="text-align:center;"></p>
<p style="text-align:center;"></p>
<p style="text-align:center;"></p>
<p style="text-align:center;"></p>
&nbsp;
<p style="text-align:center;">Endorsements</p>
<p style="text-align:left;">"Benjamin has always been motivated by his own dreams and by carving his own path; he's proud to be unique! His dreams have taken on many climbing and surfing adventures. His love of adventure is only topped by his love of friendships and brotherhood. He wants to invest time into people of all ages and continue to put others before himself.Â Benjamin is a very special person with a twinkle in his eye that tells you he is going to do great things!" - <a title="WB Surf Camp" href="http://www.wbsurfcamp.com/" target="_blank">Surf Camp</a></p>
<p style="text-align:left;">"Gnarwa photography was created by a climbing buddy of mine, Benjamin Goodpasture. The dude is super chill and takes some killer photos in his free time.Â  He lives for the right reasons (in my eyes), and is passionate about what he does." <a title="Climbing buddy" href="http://soul-climbing.com/community.html" target="_blank">Soul Climbing</a></p>
<p style="text-align:left;"></p>]]></content:encoded>
